name: Art in the style of Kandinsky

metadata.name: Poem Jakob van Hoddis "SKY SNAKE"
metadata.description:
Poem Jakob van Hoddis "SKY SNAKE"

Sun glows and nights are silent,
Step out of the bright windows
The ghosts,
fornicating
In the air.
And the city
The scent veils
their booze faces.

"Let us through the great halls
The infatuated heavens wave;
Because the moon is already far away.
The wrath of the stars faded away.
Is it sparkle, is it dark,
Is it song, prayer, rumor,
Is it palaces or junk?
Be silent, we are in the realm of miracles.‚Äù
 
Draw a hundred thousand armies
Through the cloud plane.
Hundreds of thousands of friends flee
Before the clouds caravan.
Oh, the thinker gets sick
Who should consider today.
Put him in the bucket of water.
He is great.

Made in the Kondinsky technique
